newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish PM says to announce EMU view by end of May.
newsitem.headline: Swedish PM says to announce EMU view by end of May.

text.p: Sweden's Prime Minister Goran Persson said on Wednesday his ruling Social Democratic party would announce its view on membership of Europe's economic and monetary union (EMU) by the end of May.
He also dismissed as speculation a newspaper report saying he was more negative to EMU than he officially has said.
"Before the end of this month, the Social Democratic party will announce its stance (on EMU membership)," Persson told Reuters.
"That is what we have said for a long time and we will stick to that."
Other government members have been vague lately and talked about an announcement in a few weeks' time.
Persson could not give an exact date but said the announcement would be made either before or after May 23, but not on May 23 as it would collide with a European Council meeting.
Persson also dismissed a Wednesday article in Svenska Dagbladet which quoted sources as saying Persson and Finance Minister Erik Asbrink were more negative to EMU membership than they pretend to be.
A source from the party told the newspaper that the two ministers will not openly admit that they are against a Swedish EMU membership as they fear interest rates will rise.
"Rumours, rumours, rumours," Persson said. "There are too many rumours and too few facts on this discussion."
